NAAC. Lalbaba College has 16 Departments. Bengali
data.meta_description: Former Name, Lalbaba College, Location, Howrah, West Bengal. Affiliation(s), University of Calcutta, Category, Under-Graduate. Accreditation / Recognition. Lalbaba College, established in 1964, is an undergraduate college in Howrah, India. It is affiliated with the University of Calcutta.Online Admission of lalbaba College. Lalbaba College is situated in Howrah in West Bengal state of India. Established in 1964, it is accredited from UGC, NAAC and it is affiliated to University of Calcutta, Kolkata. Lalbaba College, Howrah offers 8 courses across 3 streams namely Commerce and Banking, Science, Arts and across 3 degrees like BA, B.Com, BSc. Lalbaba College' campus is spread over 2 Acres. Hostel facility is not available for its students. Additional campus facilities such as Canteen, Computer Lab, Counselling, Cultural zone, Education Festival, Library, Cls. Room, Placement, Sports, Residential Institute are also there

Dr. Sanjay Kumar (Principal)

Principal’s Message

Dear Students, Faculty, and Staff Members,

I extend hearty greetings to all members of the Lalbaba College community.

As the Principal, I am honou

Welcome to Lalbaba College

Lalbaba College is a conglomeration of approximately four thousand students, more than eighty teachers and more than twenty non-teaching staff. It has grown into a seminary of modern learning over the years. The catchment area of the college includes its adjacent agricultural and industrialized region of the district of Howrah as also neighbouring agricultural belt of the district of Hooghly. Although initially conceived merely to promote higher education among the local youth, its hinterland of student input has increased immensely during the last decade. Students today rush here to materialize their dreams with regard to choice of subjects in higher education from distant areas connected by the Barddhaman Main and Chord lines and the Tarakeswar section of Eastern Railway and the Kharagpur section of South Eastern Railway. This is because of the fact that the college is located adjacent to Kolkata. It is just on the opposite bank of the river Hooghly next to Belur Math, the world famous monastic establishment founded by Swami Vivekananda. It is easily accessible by rail, only six kilometers journey from Howrah and fifteen kilometers from Sealdah. The nearest railway stations are Belur in the Howrah - Barddhaman Section, Belurmath in Howrah - Belurmath Section and Bally Ghat in the Sealdah – Dankuni Section of Eastern Railway.
